elements.title: Jean Schwartz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jean Schwartz and William Jerome (pictured) wrote more than 1,000 popular songs together?

elements.title: Hidden Letters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that marketers try to turn a secret women-only language into a branding device for "high-end potatoes" in the documentary Hidden Letters?

elements.title: Robert Hooke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in addition to his work as a scientist, Robert Hooke was an architect who designed the Monument to the Great Fire of London so that it could also have a practical value as a scientific instrument?

elements.title: his Christian TV station in Dallas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pat Robertson let his Christian TV station in Dallas air wrestling because it drew viewers and fetched high advertising rates?

elements.title: Ivan Ančić (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ivan Ančić was the first Bosnian Franciscan to use the Latin script to write in his native language?

elements.title: an interstate catalytic converter theft ring (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an interstate catalytic converter theft ring generated US$545 million in revenue?

elements.title: Gary Bossert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that basketball player Gary Bossert has made 11 consecutive three-point shots and at least 31 consecutive free throws?

elements.title: one of the first Polish science fiction novels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one of the first Polish science fiction novels featured a trip to the South Pole by airship, a decade before a similar airship was built?

elements.title: Miharu Hanai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that voice actresses Miharu Hanai and Aina Suzuki were revealed to be sisters when they were both cast in an anime TV series?
